dialogue.text: My phone goes off on the way to the normal breakfast hangout spot the girls have flocked to over our last several trips. But when I look down to inspect the sender, I am quickly filled with both fear and remorse.
{i}You have received a text message from Maya Makinami!{/i}
...shit.
Getting sidetracked on my quest to find the missing class members last night completely overwrote the plans I made with Maya earlier that day.
But if Maya knows me as well as she is supposed to, she should have expected such a thing and followed up with me rather than just {i}allowing{/i} me to forget her.
Unless her plan was just keeping me from going on a date with Ayane instead. To which I say...smart.
{i}Good morning. Are you still alive?{/i}
I swallow my pride and text her back to prove that my heart still beats, just not entirely for her.
{i}Good morning and yes.{/i}

{i}How unfortunate. I was beginning to hope that you had been mauled by bears as that would be the only reasonable explanation for bailing on the incredibly rare opportunity to go out on a date with me.{/i}
{i}There’s always your birthday next week.{/i}
{i}I’m shocked you’re able to remember that but not something twelve hours into the future.{/i}
{i}I forgot, Maya. I got caught up in something else.{/i}
{i}Yes, I realized that after watching you walk away from me without so much as a glance last night. But I suppose this is what I get for extending any amount of kindness to you.{/i}
{i}Texting with you sure is fun. We should do this more often.{/i}
{i}Delete my number and never talk to me again.{/i}
Welp, it’s safe to say that Maya is mad. And understandably so.

But the silver lining to this is that I made similar arrangements with her arch-nemesis tonight and, if the past repeats itself (Which it so typically does around here), I’ll be disappointing Noriko next.
And if there is anything I know about Maya, it’s that hurting Noriko will make her happy. I just...still don’t exactly understand {i}why.{/i}
Yes! I win! Take that, Miku!
I {i}told{/i} you Sensei wasn’t dead! He was probably just having a romantic rendezvous with a secret lover of his for hours and hours and hours last night!
Man! I was really bankin’ on him bein’ eaten by bears.
What is it with everyone and wanting me mauled by bears this morning?
What is it with you disappearing so early on in the night without so much as saying anything? Do you have any idea how many times I knocked on your door hoping that you were around? I was so bored.
You should’a just hung out with me and Sana. All we did was play games and that ain’t much of a social thingy.
I’ve seen the kinds of “games” she plays in her spare time and I have never been less interested in anything.
You got somethin’ against Minecraft, Io?
Uta, thank you for believing in me when Miku and many others so clearly didn’t.

Any time! You’re not off the hook {i}yet,{/i} though! Just cause I believed you were alive doesn’t mean I’m not also suspicious of your disappearance. Specially since Makoto and Futaba were gone all night as well.
Yeah! What was up with that?! I know Makoto’s been havin’ some sleepin’ problems, but she ain’t the type to just sneak out in the middle of the night without a good reason!
Well...maybe she had a good reason?
Like what? Gettin’ nasty with the teacher and everybody’s favorite librarian? This some kinda porno now?
Yeah, as if that would ever happen.
Besides, if any of you were smart enough to check this morning, you would have realized that I {i}did{/i} come home last night. I slept in my room and everything.
Hey, I’m smarter than the two of them combined.
So is Ami and that’s not saying much.
Fair.
Yeah, that tracks.
Also, if you understood anything about how my stupid brain works, you would realize that coming to your room in the {i}morning{/i} is both nerve wracking and terrifying.
I have walked in on one utterly disgusting thing during this vacation and was not about to risk the chance of walking in on a {i}second{/i} one that would just hurt my feelings as well.
Think Io means she didn’t wanna walk in on you railin’ Imani or something.
Or anyone. Yeah.
Listen, what I do in my free time is for me to know and all of {i}you{/i} to ignore if you don’t want your feelings getting hurt.
But I can guarantee you that whatever it was didn’t involve Makoto or Futaba.

I don’t believe that at all. But if I try hard enough, I can {i}make{/i} myself believe it and continue to live happily inside of my own world where the only person who matters to you is me! And sometimes Uta.
Yay...sometimes Uta...
Well, you can’t say I didn’t try.
Especially since telling them I {i}was{/i} with those two girls but that nothing happened would be met with more doubt than just flat out lying.
My night aside, what are you three doing out here so early? It seems like everyone else is still back at the inn.
You know what they say about the early bird getting the worm, don’t you? Well, today, that worm was sausage. And Uta loves herself some sausage.
Yeah. I could tell by the way you stared at me yesterday. And then asked me to come on you.
Hahah! Fun memory! Are you hungry?! Let’s eat!
Uta too, Sensei?! Am I gonna start havin’ to make a list?!
Just win a contest and make me write one. That’s been proven to work and only {i}temporarily{/i} harms the recipient.
Boy, it sure is great being able to ignore everything I don’t like hearing! Looks like my brain’s getting a workout first thing this morning!
{i}Fix this.{/i}
Fix what?
{i}You’re making things awkward.{/i}
I think it’s you who’s makin’ things awkward by whisperin’ so loudly the whole table can hear ya. And sayin’ all that stuff about lovin’ sausage. Course Sensei’s gonna capitalize on that.
Just, uhh...just so we’re all on the same page and nobody harbors any ill-will against poor and defenseless Uta-chan for things you don’t have the context for...
The...{i}coming{/i} thing was...
That was a slip of the tongue...
Hey, we don’t need to know what you’re doin’ with your tongue in your free time. I just didn’t think you guys were up to that kinda stuff together.
We’re not...and we never will be.
So, onto topics that aren’t disgusting or inappropriate for the breakfast table, do you notice anything new about me?
New? I’ve seen you with your hair down before. That’s not new.
That’s not what I’m talking about.
Uhh...
Are you...on a new medication?
Nope. But that’s a fair guess.
Io, I’m going to be honest. I have no idea what you’re talking about.
I did the thing you wanted me to do and made a new friend! I’ve been sitting next to Miku this whole time and haven’t been dying inside! Well, no more than usual at least.
And what’s even better is that it’s not Kirin!
She ain’t for everybody. I get it.
You and Miku are actually {i}friends{/i} now? That’s the least believable part of this timeskip yet.
Timeskip?
Doesn’t matter. How did {i}this{/i} happen, though? Miku’s one of the loudest- wait.
You confused her for a boy, didn’t you?
Don’t worry, Io. I forget I’m a girl sometimes too.
Well, it {i}does{/i} help that she’s not annoyingly feminine...
But we found something we can bond over!
Oh, right. You’re into baseball, aren’t you? Miku’s always been into sports-
I ain’t that into baseball, actually. Think Io’s talkin’ about her anti-mind-explosion pills.
What?
I’ve designated myself as Miku’s personal pharmacist and have been sharing some of my meds with her lately to help with her PTSD!
It’s actually been a huge help. I’ve only had a couple bad reactions so far and Io says it’s just cause she didn’t get the measurements right or somethin’.
What?
I have...a strong and uncharacteristic urge to try and be responsible right now.
Suppress it. That’s what I do with all of the stuff I’m not supposed to feel.
I think Sensei’s right, Io. I’ve been wantin’ to say something, but I don’t really think it’s a good idea to be sharing that kind of stuff with Miku if she hasn’t been prescribed it.
Not to mention I’m pretty sure that counts as drug dealing and is extremely illegal.
Technically, yes. But the chances of a girl my age actually getting in trouble for that sort of thing are basically non-existent. Plus, the meds have been helping a lot, haven’t they?
Yeah! I feel great. Haven’t had a thing happen in almost a whole month. Might even be a new record.
Plus, I ain’t got the money for that kinda stuff and Io gets it all for free. So it’s like everybody’s winning, ain’t it?
I mean...yeah, but...you’re not exactly a doctor and-
AH! THERE YOU ARE!
Uh-oh. Looks like Sensei’s in trouble now and we should all focus on the things {i}he’s{/i} doing wrong instead of me being the Robin Hood of Valium.
What do you think you’re doing disappearing for a whole night without checking in with me?! I was worried sick!
I mean, if you really want to get technical, you took your eyes off of me during Ami time, so this is {i}kind of{/i} your-
Don’t go blaming this on me, Mister! Not after I dragged Ayane and Maya around for hours looking for you in the middle of the night!
Just look at how mad Maya is! You interrupted her very strict sleeping schedule!
Yes, I’m sure that’s exactly why Maya is mad.
Did he say something, Ami? I promised myself last night I’d never listen to another word he said.
Yes. He said he hates you and that he isn’t sorry for what he did because he is a giant, insensitive jerk who I still love more than anything in the world, but come on! You’re better than this!
At least invite me out next time you vanish so I can make sure you’re not doing anything I disapprove of!
Ami, I don’t have an excuse. I wandered off looking for people and then passed out. It’s that simple.
That {i}is{/i} an excuse. And it's the {i}same{/i} excuse you've given me {i}every time{/i} you've come home super late.
Yeah, so you should know that there is a precedent for this and that I’m not lying. Case closed.
I’m not buying it. I sentence you to three consecutive years of Ami time, ending with high school graduation...
Which will then be followed by the two of us moving to a completely fenced-in facility where you are unable to leave without a passcode that only {i}I{/i} have.
It’s only fair, Sensei.
That doesn’t sound fair at all.
Sounds pretty fair to me. May I leave?
Thank you, Maya. You are excused.
Maya storms off and-
{i}Die.{/i}
{i}Do you really have to be this dramatic?{/i}
{i}Yes.{/i}
{i}Let me make it up to you tonight.{/i}
{i}No.{/i}
{i}But I need you. Without you, I will simply perish.{/i}
Who do you think you’re texting while you’re supposed to be talking to me?
Sorry. Just canceling all of my plans for the rest of eternity so we can spend that time together instead.

Great! In that case, I forgive you. And I have a whole list of activities planned out for the rest of the day where we can show our love for one another without the worry of anyone else getting in the way.
Should I wear a leash? It might help with how controlling you want to be.
Sure! I packed one just in case you wound up seeing things my way and would be happy to break it in.
Please tell me you don’t actually want to drag me around on a leash.
Okay. I don’t actually want to drag you around on a leash.
Ami.
I totally want to drag you around on a leash.
Ami drops the leash idea after a small bit of prodding and leads me to an annex of the beach inn that I have never noticed before.
It’s just beyond the manmade baths and half-concealed by fallen trees to the point where it would be very easy to overlook if you didn’t already know about it.
How she found out, I’m not sure. But I follow her regardless, staying closely behind until she opens the doors and signals for me to go in first.
